medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms.A presented with chills and postnasal drip; five days later, she exhibited abrupt onset of mania characterized by insomnia, belligerence, and irrational speech, following the use of a steroid nasal spray. Her manic episodes typically evolved from hypomania to mania with psychosis over a period of 4 to 8 weeks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient has a history of bipolar disorder with six hospitalizations for mania since age 25.
medical_history.social_history: Prior to the recent episode, the patient was compliant with her lithium treatment, had no reported drug abuse, was gainfully employed, and was actively managing her own illness.
